title: Lenz Moser 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Fresh, friendly green pear notes glide all the way from nose to palate and make for easy, inviting summer drinking. The clean finish smacks of lemon. Drink soon.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G White (Côtes de Provence)
description: A blend with mainly Rolle and some Clairette, this is light, bright and crisp. Floral aromas lead to sliced apple and lime juice flavors that offer lively acidity and a tangy, zesty aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Garofoli 2014 Macrina  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This zesty, straightforward white offers aromas of Spanish broom and acacia flower while the bright palate offers golden delicious apple and citrus. A pleasant note of bitter almond backs up the finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: La Monacesca 2014  Verdicchio di Matelica
description: Delicate aromas suggesting chamomile flower and acacia honey carry over to the linear but somewhat lean palate along with hints of citrus and yellow apple. Racy acidity provides the backbone while a bitter almond note marks the finish.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Crisp starfruit and citrus notes shine brightly throughout this refreshingly spry white. It's delicate in concentration but irresistibly quaffable, marked by a spray of salinity on the finish.

title: Herzog 2014 Camouflage Red (California)
description: Slightly herbal aromas and generous, almost chocolaty fruit flavors make for a mouth-filling wine. It is full bodied, moderately tannic, and nicely dry despite the bold fruit character.

title: Hoopes 2014 Genny's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Weighty but polished, this wine is full bodied, moderately flavorful and very smooth in texture. It has mild pear, butter and vanilla accents, subtle acidity and a plush mouthfeel.

title: Hunt Cellars 2010 Maestro Destiny Vineyards Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of smoked black plum, rustic leather and smoked meats show on this super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petite Sirah. Dried blueberries, fudge, beef char and very tarry elements show on the palate.

title: Château Roubine 2014 La Vie en Rose Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: In place of freshness this pale-colored wine is ripe and has weight, which brings out rounded red fruits with a touch of spice and pepper. The acidity comes through slowly at the end.

title: Cantina Produttori Cortaccia 2013 Frauenrigl Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Muted aromas suggesting vanilla, cassis and dark spice emerge in the glass while the palate shows roasted coffee bean and dried black cherry. Dusty tannins give it mouth-puckering astringency. Drink through 2016.

title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2013 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: The nose is rather closed, but eventually reveals subdued aromas of cassis, violet and a whiff of eucalyptus. The palate offers blackberry, tangerine zest, rhubarb and a hint of ground pepper alongside grippy tannins.

title: Cascina Chicco 2015 Anterisio  (Roero)
description: Delicate scents of beeswax and white spring flower lift out of the glass. The round, juicy palate offers mature pear, white almond and a hint of citrus alongside soft acidity.

title: Château Barbanau 2015 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Pale in color, this is a light, bright style of rosé. It is clean and crisp, with touches of red fruit that float through the attractive fresh acidity. The aftertaste is fleeting and refreshing.

title: Château Carpe Diem 2015 Castillo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From a small parcel of vines, this wine is rich, peppery and weighty. With its tannic edge and tight texture, it needs some aging. Give this structured wine until late 2016.

title: Château Cavalier 2015 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: For a Provence rosé, this is dark in color, with a rich salmon-pink appearance. It is full, with a caramel flavor that gives a sweet edge to the crisp red fruits. The Castel family of Bordeaux owns this property.

title: Château de Pourcieux 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This lively, lightly herbal blend includes Cabernet Sauvignon and white Vermentino. It pivots deftly on a texture that is mineral, crisp, and contrasting with the red fruits. It is ready to drink.

title: Château Romanin 2013 La Chapelle Red (Les Baux de Provence)
description: This juicy, earthy wine already shows some maturity. It has leathery tannins as well as younger berry fruits that are still present. A blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, it has underlying dryness that gives shape to the ripe texture. Drink now.

title: Byington 2013 Byington Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Tight purple fruit smells of black raspberry meet with violets, crushed slate, dried rose petals, raw beef and black peppercorns on the focused nose. The palate is very slate-driven and rocky, offering turned earth, juniper and more dark raspberry flavors. It is still very tightly wound, and needs more time to unfurl.

title: Cà dei Frati 2014 Brolettino  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of oak, dill and citrus lead the way. On the medium-bodied palate, butterscotch and other oak-driven spice sensations dominate candied nectarine zest and yellow apple.

title: Agricola Pace 2015  Roero
description: Floral aromas reminiscent of citrus blossom, tuberose and black locust flower lift out of the glass. The bright, straightforward palate offers Bosc pear, lemon drop and toasted hazelnut alongside soft but fresh enough acidity.

title: Ballentine 2013 Block 9 Reserve Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This wine opens in a combination of herbal mint and brown sugar, ultimately smacking the palate with a big, bold presence that's hyper-ripe. The size is significant and in need of equally bold, brawny and spicy food.

title: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
description: Here's a vibrant, easygoing white wine that offers flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's straightforward but well made and refreshing.

title: Bersano 2015  Roero
description: Subtle aromas of acacia flower and a whiff of almond lead the way. The round, easygoing palate offers pear, citrus peel and a hint of hazelnut alongside soft acidity.

title: Boeger 2015 Rosé (El Dorado)
description: Almost deep enough in color to be a red, this pleasantly dry wine made from Barbera and Mourvèdre grapes smells and tastes like raspberries, and is on the light side in terms of body. Drink it up before the next vintage comes out.

title: Ten Sisters 2015 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A bit austere, this is an undeniably crisp offering. Delicate herbal notes accent underripe pineapple and white grapefruit, then end on a dry, stony note.

title: Raphael 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
description: This fresh, simple white smells of white wild flower and yellow stone fruit. The zesty palate offers lime and Bosc pear alongside tangy acidity that leads to a clean finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Peter Zemmer 2012 Riserva Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Here's an earthy red that opens with aromas suggesting smoke, tilled soil and leather. The solid, straightforward palate offers mature plum and a hint of almond alongside rather grainy, astringent tannins. Drink through 2017.

title: Château Beaulieu 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Holding 442 acres—one of the largest vineyards in Coteaux d'Aix-en Provence—this property produces a simple, refreshing wine. It brings forward red fruits that are cut with acidity. Light and buoyant, it is a fine apéritif style.

title: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2014 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Flinty notes suggest a touch of reduction. Underneath, notes of blueberry and cherry are crunchy and pure. This is fresh, medium-bodied with a slight tannic grip and ample freshness. Drink soon.

title: Eco Terreno 2012 Three Vine Red (Alexander Valley)
description: The three vines responsible for this wine are Merlot and Cabernet Franc in near-equal proportion, with 11% Petit Verdot, all aged in American oak, the majority of it neutral. It opens reminiscent of an Italian deli—meaty and powerful, with sizable tannin presence and a smoky air.
